reviews.text: I visited London for New Year's Eve. The hotel is situated in a quiet area, opposite Lambeth Palace and 10 minutes walk from Parliament and Big Ben. The location was great for watching the fireworks show for New Year's Eve. London is a great city, with shops open 7 days from 7, even on the first day of the year. Regarding the hotel, the rooms are very large and modern decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and in the evening buffet restaurant menu is offered. The only minus was heating and ventilation system that was inefficient and noisy.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for visiting London

reviews.text: This was a wonderful hotel - we stayed from 2nd January to 12th January 2012. The staff were great and the room excellent. Had all amenities - the breakfast buffet was lovely and fresh each day and room service was excellent. A few points though - one day we got back from walking around London all day and were disappointed to find our room not made up but a quick call to housekeeping fixed it. My only gripe is they asked to take a $100 holding deposit which I said was fine but when booking out asked the lady behind the desk to make sure that was cancelled, as I had paid my bill in cash in full. On returning home to Australia I saw the money had been withdrawn from my credit card. They should only take an indent of my card - not actually take my money unless I did not pay. Except for that - the hotel was wonderful and would definitely recommend it to people to stay there.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - pity about the deposit 'held' on my credit card

I had booked the hotel a couple of weeks ago for a three night break for myself,wife son,daugher and their partners and my three year old grandaughter. We checked in 12/1/2012 Thursday eveniing and Isabelle at the front desk was very helpful and polite. I had asked for our three rooms to be close together on the same floor and if possible overlooking the Thames. We were allocated rooms 408-406-404. The rooms were very clean and suited all of our needs, rooms 408 and 406 were adjoining and our three year old grandaughter thought this was great fun. As requested the rooms had views of big ben,london eye,and st. pauls absolutely fantastic, particularly at night when lit up. The hotel location was superb only one minute from the Thames and five minutes from Westminster. Breakfast was fresh,plentiful and the service excellent. All of us are looking forward to our next stay at this superb hotel.
reviews.title: Family Weekend/Wedding Anniversary/50th Birthday
christmas in london
reviews.text: We often stay here, a great hotel good location and friendly helpful staff. Food is excellent and parking is good value for London. We were amazed at how busy the hotel was over the festive season, and how the staff were always very helpful and cheerful.

My best mate and I stayed here for 1 night on a girls night out in London (and what fun we had). Staff were helpful and very friendly, location was ok-ish bit of a walk to the tube stations (Lambeth North was the nearest bout 15mins walk) but taxis were always outside. The room was clean and tidy, the view was a bit disappointing mind, but we werent there to sit in our room and stare out the window all day! The hotel in general was spick and span, funky modern decor and furniture. Cant remember much about the breakfast, had a terrible hangover, but from what I did see, it was plentyful and loads to choose from.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Comfortable and Clean Environment

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel with my husband and parents for my sister's funeral. The staff were aware of the reason for our stay and were incredibly kind and caring. There kindness made the stay more bearable and it was amazing to find this at a large chain hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly and caring service

description: Just one step away from the River Thames, Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament and minutes away from the London Eye. Enjoy a fantastic stay in our spacious air-conditioned bedrooms, with an exceptionally comfortable Queen size bed, en-suite facilities, LCD TV, large desk and a laptop size safe. Some rooms offer amazing views of the London skyline. Be tempted by our varied buffet breakfast and our tasty international cuisine served in our Elements Restaurant. Sit back and relax with a cocktail in our Elements Bar. Up to 2 children (under 16 years) can stay free (with breakfast) when sharing a room with adults. Access to kid’s play corner, an Xbox console, Vauxhall City Farm and other family friendly activities mins away. Unwind in our In Balance Fitness and Wellbeing centre, complementary for our guests. Convenient links to the heart of the city within walking distance to underground stations, bus stops and city rental bikes. On site paying car park.
